items.title: Install Tailwind CSS and configure brand design tokens
items.description:
Install @astrojs/tailwind and tailwindcss. Create tailwind.config.mjs with the design tokens from WEBSITE_BRIEF.md Section 7 (v2.0):

Colors: Dark #0F172A (navy — nav, footer, dark sections), Accent #FF6B35 (warm orange — CTAs, links, brand mark), Accent Secondary #6366F1 (indigo — supporting highlights), Light BG #FFFFFF/#F8FAFC, Text #1E293B (slate-800), Muted #64748B (slate-500).

Typography: Cabinet Grotesk (700-800) for headlines — this is the bold brand differentiator. Inter (400-500) for body. Space Grotesk (500-700) for stats/callouts/numbers. Load Cabinet Grotesk and Space Grotesk via Google Fonts or Fontsource. Inter can use system font stack or Fontsource.

Breakpoints: Mobile <640px, Tablet 640-1024px, Desktop >1024px with max-width 1280px container.

Add a base CSS layer with font-face declarations and CSS custom properties for the brand colors. Ensure the orange (#FF6B35) passes WCAG AA contrast on both navy and white backgrounds for large text.
acceptanceCriteria: Tailwind CSS is installed and integrated with Astro via @astrojs/tailwind
tailwind.config.mjs defines all brand colors (navy, orange, indigo, light, text, muted), fonts, and breakpoints from brief Section 7
Cabinet Grotesk, Space Grotesk, and Inter fonts are loaded and available
Orange accent (#FF6B35) passes WCAG AA contrast check for large text on navy and white
npm run build succeeds with Tailwind configured
items.groomingNotes: FOUNDATION: Everything depends on this. Must be first sprint. The bold color/type choices are a key differentiator — Cabinet Grotesk for headlines and orange accent are deliberate departures from generic tech aesthetic.

items.title: Build Layout.astro shell with Header and Footer components
items.description:
Rebuild src/layouts/Layout.astro as the base HTML shell for all pages. It should accept props for title, description, and ogImage.

Create src/components/Header.astro — responsive navigation per brief Section 8 (v2.0):
- Nav links: Services, Results, About
- CTA button: 'Get Your Free Audit' (orange #FF6B35 background) linking to /contact
- Mobile: hamburger menu (JavaScript island or CSS-only)
- Sticky header on scroll
- Brand name 'Jodie Plant' as text in Cabinet Grotesk (no image logo yet)

Create src/components/Footer.astro per brief Section 8 (v2.0):
- Links: Services | Results | About | Contact
- Email: jodie@jodieplant.com
- LinkedIn link placeholder
- Availability signal: 'Currently taking on new clients for Q2 2026'
- Copyright: © 2026 Jodie Plant Marketing

Layout wraps Header + <slot /> + Footer. Includes viewport meta, favicon links, font loading, and prefers-reduced-motion support.

Header shows nav links (Services, Results, About) and orange 'Get Your Free Audit' CTA button
Header is sticky and responsive — hamburger menu on mobile (<640px)

Cabinet Grotesk is used for brand name in header

items.groomingNotes: FOUNDATION: Layout, Header, and Footer are the structural shell. The orange CTA in the nav and availability signal in the footer are conversion elements that appear on every page.

items.title: Build Homepage with condensed high-impact sections
items.description:
Build src/pages/index.astro as the homepage per brief Section 9 (v2.0). Condensed to 5 high-impact sections (down from 7). Startup founders are time-poor — every section must earn the next scroll.

Sections (in order):

1. HERO (above the fold, dark navy background):
- Headline in Cabinet Grotesk 800, large scale (e.g., 'Marketing that moves the needle for tech companies')
- Subhead: 1-2 sentences — AI-forward, senior-level, full-service value prop
- Primary CTA: 'Get Your Free Marketing Audit' (orange button → /contact)
- Secondary CTA: 'See How I Work' (text link → /results)
- Availability signal: small text 'Currently taking on 2 new clients for Q2 2026'
- Visual: clean typographic hero, subtle geometric pattern or gradient. No stock photos

2. SOCIAL PROOF BAR (immediately after hero — most important trust signal):
- 3-4 credential stats in Space Grotesk at large scale with orange accent on key numbers
- Stats MUST be real: years experience, campaigns delivered, ad spend managed, etc.
- If client logos available: 'Trusted by' logo bar
- If testimonial available: one pull quote
- Light background. This section appears before any other content because trust comes first for services businesses

3. HOW I'M DIFFERENT (combines old Problem + Jodie Difference):
- Opening line: 'Tired of agencies that hand you off to juniors?'
- Three bold differentiator cards: AI-Powered, Senior-Level Always, Full-Service
- Each card: orange icon/accent + title + 1-2 sentence explanation
- CTA: 'See what I'd do for your startup →' linking to /contact

4. SERVICES OVERVIEW:
- Intro line: 'Full-service marketing. Every channel. One partner.'
- 6 service cards in responsive grid (2×3 desktop, stacked mobile)
- Each card: icon + service name + one-line benefit from Section 5
- Each links to /services (with anchor to relevant section)

5. FINAL CTA (dark navy background):
- Headline: 'Ready to see what AI-powered marketing can do for your startup?'
- Orange CTA button: 'Get Your Free Marketing Audit' → /contact
- Supporting text: 'Or email me directly: jodie@jodieplant.com'
- Availability: 'Currently accepting new clients for Q2 2026'

Tone: Bold, confident, direct. Use Cabinet Grotesk for all section headlines.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage has exactly 5 sections: Hero, Social Proof Bar, How I'm Different, Services Overview, Final CTA
Hero has dark navy background with bold Cabinet Grotesk headline and orange CTA
Social proof bar appears immediately after hero with real credential stats (not placeholder)
How I'm Different section has 3 differentiator cards with orange accents
Services overview shows 6 cards in responsive grid linking to /services
Final CTA uses dark navy background with orange button
Availability signal appears in hero and final CTA sections
All internal links work (/services, /results, /contact)
Page is fully responsive (single column mobile, multi-column desktop)
npm run build succeeds
items.groomingNotes: CRITICAL: Primary conversion page. Social proof bar placement (immediately after hero) is a deliberate best-practice decision — trust before content. Stats must be real numbers.

items.title: Build About page with story, approach, and AI advantage
items.description:
Build src/pages/about.astro per brief Section 9 (v2.0) 'About Page'.

Purpose: Build trust and personal connection. 'Solo' means 'senior-level attention' not 'under-resourced.'

Sections:

1. HERO: Cabinet Grotesk headline 'One marketer. Full attention. Real results.' Brief positioning statement.

2. JODIE'S STORY: Background and experience. Why she started the agency. Philosophy: senior talent, AI-enhanced, no bloat. Authentic voice — personal, not corporate. Use placeholder copy that captures the right tone (to be replaced with real bio).

3. THE APPROACH: 4 numbered steps — (1) Understand your business, (2) Build data-driven strategy, (3) Execute with AI-enhanced workflows, (4) Measure, report, iterate. Visual: numbered steps or timeline. Emphasis on transparency.

4. THE AI ADVANTAGE: How AI tools deliver better results — research at scale, content optimization, campaign management, reporting. Key message: augmenting human strategy, not replacing it.

5. CTA: 'Let's talk about your marketing' with links to /contact (form) AND jodie@jodieplant.com (email) — dual paths.
acceptanceCriteria: About page has all 5 sections: Hero, Story, Approach, AI Advantage, CTA
Hero uses Cabinet Grotesk headline
Story section has placeholder bio in bold, personal tone (not corporate)
Approach section shows 4 numbered steps in a visually clear format
AI Advantage section explains how AI enhances marketing delivery
CTA offers both form link (/contact) and direct email
Page is fully responsive
npm run build succeeds
items.groomingNotes: HIGH VALUE: Trust page for a solo practitioner. The AI Advantage section is unique to this agency and reinforces the core differentiator.

items.title: Build Services page with AI-led structure and engagement models
items.description:
Build src/pages/services.astro per brief Section 9 (v2.0) 'Services Page'.

CRITICAL: This page must NOT read like a generic freelancer service list. Lead with the AI method, not just the menu.

Sections:

1. HERO: Cabinet Grotesk headline 'AI-Powered Marketing for Tech Companies'. Subhead about AI-enhanced workflows giving agency output from a senior practitioner.

2. THE AI-ENHANCED METHOD (before individual services): Brief explanation of how AI changes marketing delivery. Specific examples, not generic AI pitch. This section is what makes the page different from every other freelancer's site.

3. SERVICE BLOCKS: 6 services, each structured as 'AI difference + Deliverables + Client benefit'. Order by differentiation strength: (1) Content Marketing, (2) SEO, (3) Paid Advertising, (4) Analytics & Reporting, (5) Social Media, (6) Email Marketing.

Each block has:
- Service name and icon (orange accent)
- 'The AI difference' — 1-2 sentences specific to THIS service (from brief Section 5)
- Key deliverables (3-5 bullets)
- Benefit one-liner

Alternating layout to prevent monotony.

4. HOW ENGAGEMENTS WORK: Three models — Monthly Retainer ('Most clients start here'), Project-Based, Advisory. What a typical month looks like. Reporting cadence.

5. CTA: 'Not sure what you need? Let's figure it out together.' + 'Get Your Free Marketing Audit' → /contact + jodie@jodieplant.com.
acceptanceCriteria: Services page has Hero, AI Method section, 6 Service Blocks, Engagements, and CTA
AI-Enhanced Method section appears BEFORE individual services
Each service block leads with 'The AI difference' specific to that service
Services ordered by differentiation strength (Content first, Email last)
Engagement section explains three models (retainer, project, advisory)
All service blocks are scannable with alternating visual layout
Orange accents used for service icons and highlights
CTA offers form link and email
npm run build succeeds
items.groomingNotes: CRITICAL: This page must differentiate from every other marketing freelancer. The AI-led structure is the key — method before menu. Service ordering (most differentiating first) is deliberate.

items.title: Build Results page with real credentials and methodology (not fake case studies)
items.description:
Build src/pages/results.astro per brief Section 9 (v2.0) 'Results Page'.

CRITICAL: This is NOT a portfolio page with fake case studies. Placeholder case studies with fabricated metrics actively harm credibility. This page uses real credentials and methodology to demonstrate expertise.

Sections:

1. HERO: Cabinet Grotesk headline 'What You Can Expect'. Subhead: honest framing — 'I don't have a portfolio of logos to hide behind. Here's what I bring instead — real experience, a proven approach, and the results to back it up.'

2. CREDENTIALS & NUMBERS: Real, provable stats in Space Grotesk at large scale — years experience, campaigns/projects delivered, ad spend managed, client retention, industries worked with. MUST be real. Small but honest beats large but fabricated.

3. THE APPROACH IN ACTION: Instead of fake case studies, show methodology applied:
- 'What a typical SEO engagement looks like' — month-by-month
- 'How I'd approach a startup launch campaign' — step-by-step
- 'What a monthly retainer delivers' — concrete deliverables
Demonstrates expertise without fabricating results.

4. WHAT CLIENTS SAY: Real testimonials, LinkedIn recommendations, or professional endorsements. Even 1-2 is better than none. If no client testimonials exist: results from past roles with appropriate framing. Structure ready for adding real testimonials later.

5. INDUSTRIES & EXPERIENCE: Types of companies Jodie works with — SaaS, fintech, dev tools, etc. Pattern recognition: 'I've seen what works for companies like yours.'

6. CTA: 'Want to see what I'd do for your company?' + 'Get Your Free Marketing Audit' → /contact.
acceptanceCriteria: Results page has Hero, Credentials, Approach in Action, Client Testimonials, Industries, and CTA
No fake case studies or fabricated metrics anywhere on the page
Credentials section uses Space Grotesk at large scale for real stats
Approach in Action section shows methodology through real scenario walkthroughs
Testimonials section has structure ready for real content (even if placeholder notes 'coming soon')
Hero acknowledges the honest positioning rather than pretending to have a portfolio
Page is fully responsive
npm run build succeeds
items.groomingNotes: HIGH VALUE: Reframed from fake portfolio to honest credentials page. This is more credible and more useful for a new agency. The methodology walkthroughs answer 'what do I actually get?' which is what prospects really want to know.

items.title: Build Contact page with form, email, and calendar — multiple conversion paths
items.description:
Build src/pages/contact.astro per brief Section 9 (v2.0) 'Contact Page'.

CRITICAL: Multiple conversion paths, not just mailto:. A form is lower friction than composing an email from scratch. Different prospects prefer different channels.

Sections:

1. HERO: Cabinet Grotesk headline 'Let's Talk'. Subhead: 'Whether you want a free audit, have a quick question, or are ready to get started — I'm here.'

2. FREE MARKETING AUDIT FORM (primary conversion path):
- Headline: 'Get Your Free Marketing Audit'
- Description: 'Tell me a bit about your company and I'll send you a personalised assessment...'
- Form fields: Name, Company name, Company URL, Biggest marketing challenge (short text or dropdown), Budget range (optional dropdown: <£2k, £2-5k, £5-10k, £10k+)
- Submit to Formspree or Formspark (static-site compatible, sends to email)
- Confirmation: 'Thanks! I'll review your marketing and get back to you within 24 hours.'
- Form validation with helpful error messages

3. OTHER WAYS TO REACH ME:
- Email: jodie@jodieplant.com with mailto: link
- Book a call: placeholder for Cal.com/Calendly link (Phase 2) — can show as 'Coming soon' or omit until ready
- LinkedIn: profile link

4. WHAT TO EXPECT:
- 'I respond to every enquiry within 24 hours'
- 'Audit responses include a personalised assessment, not a generic template'
- 'No pressure, no hard sell'

5. AVAILABILITY:
- 'Currently taking on 2 new clients for Q2 2026'
- Creates urgency without being pushy
acceptanceCriteria: Contact page has Hero, Audit Form, Other Contact Methods, Expectations, and Availability sections
Form has fields for name, company, URL, challenge, and optional budget range
Form submits to Formspree/Formspark (or similar static-compatible service) and sends to email
Form shows confirmation message after successful submission
Form has client-side validation with helpful error messages
Email mailto: link is prominent alongside the form (not hidden)
Availability signal creates urgency ('Currently taking on 2 new clients')
Calendar booking link has placeholder structure for Phase 2
Page is fully responsive
npm run build succeeds
items.groomingNotes: CRITICAL: Conversion endpoint. The form is lower friction than mailto: — prospect doesn't need to context-switch to email client. The audit framing gives the prospect something concrete in return for reaching out. Availability signal drives urgency.

items.title: Integrate Plausible analytics with MVP event tracking
items.description:
Add Plausible analytics per brief Section 11 (v2.0). Plausible is recommended over PostHog for MVP — privacy-focused, no cookie banner needed, simpler setup.

MVP events to track:
- $pageview (automatic)
- cta_clicked (any CTA button click)
- email_clicked (mailto: link click)
- form_submitted (contact/audit form submission)
- contact_page_reached (/contact page load)

Add Plausible script to Layout.astro (load async). Add data attributes for custom event tracking on CTA buttons, mailto links, and form submission. Use environment variable for domain config.
acceptanceCriteria: Plausible script loads on all pages via Layout.astro
Page views tracked automatically
CTA clicks fire cta_clicked events
mailto: clicks fire email_clicked events
Form submissions fire form_submitted events
/contact loads fire contact_page_reached event
Script loads async without blocking rendering
No cookie banner needed (Plausible is cookieless)
npm run build succeeds
items.groomingNotes: HIGH VALUE: Can't measure KPIs from brief Section 13 without analytics. Plausible specifically chosen for no-cookie simplicity — no GDPR banner overhead.

items.title: Add scroll animations and micro-interactions
items.description:

- Hover effects on service cards and CTA buttons (scale, shadow, color shift)
- Smooth scroll for anchor links
- All animations respect prefers-reduced-motion media query

Keep it subtle — enhance, don't distract. No heavy animation libraries; use CSS transitions and minimal JS.

items.title: Add blog infrastructure with 2-3 seed posts
items.description:
Set up blog per brief Appendix C (v2.0) — this is a Phase 2 PRIORITY, not Phase 3.

A marketer without a blog is like a chef without a menu. Blog content demonstrates the expertise being sold.

Technical: Use Astro Content Collections with markdown files. Create:
- /blog listing page with featured post
- /blog/[slug] individual post pages
- CTA at end of each post ('Want help implementing this? Get your free audit')

Seed posts (2-3 at launch):
1. 'How to build a marketing strategy for your seed-stage startup'
2. 'SEO vs paid ads: where should startups spend first?'
3. 'What an AI-powered marketing workflow actually looks like'

Posts should be real, substantive content (800-1500 words) that demonstrates Jodie's expertise. These are NOT placeholder posts.
